00107 inline bool isDirExist(const char* dirPath)
00108 {
00109     if(dirPath == 0)
00110         return false;
00111 
00112     bool result = false;
00113 
00114 #if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(__CYGWIN__)
00115     WIN32_FIND_DATA wfd;
00116     HANDLE hFind;
00117 
00118     // the parameter string in function "FindFirstFile()" would be invalid if it ends with a trailing backslash (\) or slash (/),
00119     // so the trailing backslash or slash is removed if it exists
00120     std::string dirStr(dirPath);
00121     size_t len = dirStr.size();
00122     if(len > 0 && strchr(PATH_DELIMIT_CHECK, dirPath[len-1]))
00123     {
00124         dirStr.erase(len-1, 1);
00125     }
00126 
00127     hFind = FindFirstFile(dirStr.c_str(), &wfd);
00128     if(hFind != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
00129     {
00130         result = true;
00131     }
00132     FindClose(hFind);
00133 #else
00134     DIR *dir = opendir(dirPath);
00135     if(dir)
00136         result = true;
00137 
00138     closedir(dir);
00139 #endif
00140 
00141     return result;
00142 }

00151 {
00152     assert(src && dest);
00153

00155     std::ifstream from(src, std::ios::binary);
00156     if(! from)

00158         std::cerr << "cannot open source file: " << src << std::endl;
00159         return false;
00160     }
00161 
00162     std::ofstream to(dest, std::ios::binary);
00163     if(! to)
00164     {
00165         std::cerr << "cannot open destinatioin file: " << dest << std::endl;
00166         return false;
00167     }
00168 
00169     // copy characters
00170     char ch;
00171     while(from.get(ch))
00172         to.put(ch);
00173 
00174     // check file state
00175     if(!from.eof() || !to)
00176     {
00177         std::cerr << "invalid file state after copy from " << src << " to " << dest << std::endl;
00178         return false;
00179     }
00180 
00181     return true;

00226 inline std::string getDirPath(const std::string& filePath)
00227 {
00228     if(filePath.empty())
00229         return "";
00230 
00231     size_t last = filePath.find_last_of(PATH_DELIMIT_CHECK);
00232     if(last == std::string::npos)
00233         return ".";
00234 
00235     last = filePath.find_last_not_of(PATH_DELIMIT_CHECK, last);
00236     if(last == std::string::npos)
00237         return ".";
00238

00247 inline std::string normalizeDirPath(const std::string& dirPath)
00248 {
00249     if(dirPath.size() && strchr(PATH_DELIMIT_CHECK, dirPath[dirPath.size()-1]))
00250     {
00251         size_t last = dirPath.find_last_not_of(PATH_DELIMIT_CHECK);
00252         if(last != std::string::npos)
00253             return dirPath.substr(0, last+1);
00254         else
00255             return ""; // in case of invalid input of "/////";
00256     }
00257
